key_points: The KFF COVID-19 Vaccine Monitor tracks public attitudes and experiences with COVID-19 vaccinations.
48% of parents of children ages 12-17 report their child has received at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine.
About a third (34%) of parents say they will vaccinate their 5-11 year old child 'right away' once a vaccine is authorized for their age group.
58% of parents believe K-12 schools should require all students and staff to wear masks.
69% of parents with a child attending in-person school say their school is requiring masks for all students and staff.
23% of parents of a child attending in-person school report their child has been required to quarantine due to a possible COVID-19 exposure.
32% of parents will 'wait and see' before getting their 5-11 year old vaccinated, and 24% say they definitely will not vaccinate their 5-11 year old.
66% of parents with a child attending in-person school believe their child's school is doing the right amount to limit the spread of COVID-19.
Only 6% of parents report their school district offers routine COVID-19 testing to students not eligible for the vaccine.
57% of parents are worried their child may get seriously sick from coronavirus, with concern higher among Hispanic and lower-income parents.
